She tours with the Chicago-based metal band [[Urn (band)|URN]] and performed on URN's ''Desecrated Ashes'' (2003) and ''Dancing with the Demigods'' (2006). She also wrote the lyrics to several URN songs, "Esoterica's" and "The God Within." She also performed on Xyla's ''Esoterica'' (2007). Belanger performed as a guest vocalist on [[Nox Arcana]]'s ''[[Winter's Knight]]'' (2005) which ranked #8 on the ''[[Billboard Magazine|Billboard]]'' chart for Top Holiday Albums.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/search/?keyword=nox+arcana&x=0&y=0#/charts/holiday-albums?chartDate=2007-01-27 |title=Billboard ranking for [[Winter's Knight]] |publisher=Billboard Magazine |accessdate=2007-01-27 }} She performed again with Nox Arcana as the lead vocalist on ''[[Blood of Angels]]'' (2006). ===Blood of Angels=== '''''Blood of Angels''''' is a musical collaboration between Michelle Belanger and the musical group [[Nox Arcana]], released on the Monolith Graphics label in October 2006. ''Blood of Angels'' is the 6th album in the Nox Arcana discography, and their first full-length collaborative work. The album was recorded in just 5 days while Nox Arcana were simultaneously working on their 7th album, ''[[Blood of the Dragon (album)|Blood of the Dragon]].'' {{cite web |url=http://josephvargo.com/music.html |title=Joseph Vargo's official website |accessdate=2009-05-31 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.flamesrising.com/interview-with-joseph-vargo-artist-musician |title=Flames Rising interview with Joseph Vargo |accessdate=2009-05-31 }} Unlike Nox Arcana's other releases, which are primarily instrumental with minimal narratives, these songs feature both lyrical and musical content on every track. {{cite web |url=http://musicstreetjournal.com/interviews_display.cfm?id=100086 |title=Interview with Nox Arcana |publisher=Music Street Journal |accessdate=2009-05-13 }} Joseph Vargo and William Piotrowski wrote and performed the music. Michelle Belanger wrote and performed the lyrics, which draw upon ancient [[Enochian]] myths to tell a story about mythical [[Watcher (angel)|Watcher Angels]], who "abandoned Heaven for a taste of mortal love." ''Blood of Angels'' liner notes.{{Cite news | last =Devon | first =King | publication-date = October 2006 | title =Michelle Belanger | periodical =Dark Realms Magazine | issue =24 | pages =32â33 | url =http://www.noxarcana.com/interviews/DR24.pdf | accessdate =2009-05-15 | postscript =. }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} According to the Enochian legend, the [[Watcher (angel)|Watchers]] (also called [[Grigori]] or "Fallen Angels") are celestial beings who were condemned to the earthly realm after uniting with mortals and sharing with them their mystical secrets. The theme of this album was the topic of the "Blood of Angels" discussion panel at Dragoncon in 2009. {{cite web |url=http://www.dragoncon.org/dc_guest_detail.php?id=1501 |title=Michelle Belanger guest speaker at Dragoncon |accessdate=2009-05-13 }} {{cite web |url=http://www.talechasing.com/2009/03/30/episode-25-dragoncon-09-gothic-panel-blood-of-angels |title=Michelle Belanger describing Ecochian myth and Watchers for the Dragoncon "Blood of Angels" panel. |accessdate=2009-05-13 }} The title track features a chant consisting of several [[List of angels|angelic]] and [[List of theological demons|demonic names]] from Christian mythology, as well as names from Jewish mythology and [[The Book of Enoch#The Book of the Watchers|The Book of Enoch]]: [[Azazel]], [[Sariel]], [[Kokabiel|Koshbiel]], and [[Shamsiel]], [[Hanameel the Egyptian|Ananel]], [[Selaphiel|Sethiel]], [[Raziel]], and [[Zaqiel|Zaquiel]]. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.michellebelanger.com/index.html Michelle Belanger homepage] *{{myspace|michellebelanger|Michelle Belanger}} *[http://www.shadowdancepodcast.com/ Shadowdance Podcast (2008)] *[http://www.llewellyn.com/ Llewllyn Press] *[http://michellebelanger.libsyn.com/ Chasing Infinity Podcast] *[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r1022056|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic profile] {{Persondata | NAME =Belanger, Michelle | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =1973-01-11 | PLACE OF BIRTH =Ravenna, Ohio, United States | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Belanger, Michelle}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:American female singers]] [[Category:American occult writers]] [[Category:American occultists]] [[Category:American spiritual writers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Paranormal investigators]] [[Category:Writers from Ohio]] [[Category:American women writers]] [[Category:Intersex people]]
